problem_text:
If G = HK is a soluble group and H, K are minimax groups, is it true that G is a minimax group?
D. J. S. Robinson
answer: Yes, it is true (J. S. Wilson, J. Pure Appl. Algebra, 53, no. 3 (1988), 297–318; Ya. P. Sysak, Radical modules over groups of finite rank, Inst. of Math. Acad. Sci. Ukrain. SSR, Kiev, 1989 (Russian)).
